comment.text: This translation key "SetToDefault" is used to display a label that indicates setting the quota to its default value. It is typically displayed in UI elements such as menus or buttons, prompting users to reset their quota to the default configuration. The exact wording and appearance may vary depending on the context in which it appears, but its purpose remains consistent.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "تعيين الاعدادات الافتراضية" is a more literal and verbose translation of "Set to default". A more concise and natural-sounding translation would be preferable.

While "Defolta ayarlayın" is understandable, a more natural and accurate translation of "Set to default" in Azerbaijani would be "Varsayılan qaymaya keçirin" or "Standartaya qaytarın". "Ayarlayın" implies a more manual adjustment.
While 'Nastavení na výchozí hodnotu' is understandable, it's a bit verbose for 'Set to default'. A more concise and natural translation would be better.
While technically correct, "Ορισμός σε προεπιλεγμένη τιμή" is a very literal and somewhat clunky translation of "Set to default." It sounds overly formal and technical for most user interfaces.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A more natural and user-friendly translation would be something like "Επαναφορά στις προεπιλογές" or "Προεπιλογή".

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While 'Սահմանել լռելյայն' is a literal translation of 'Set to default', it sounds overly formal and technical for a typical UI element. A more natural and user-friendly translation might be preferable.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider alternatives like 'Դեֆոլտի վրա' (Defolti vra) or 'Սկզբնական վիճակ' (Sghebnyakn vikak), depending on the specific context.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Polish translation 'Ustawiono wartość domyślną' translates more accurately to 'The default value has been set'. It's a passive construction and changes the meaning slightly from the English 'Set to default', which implies an action the user can perform. A more accurate and user-friendly translation would be 'Przywróć domyślne ustawienia' or 'Domyślne ustawienia'.

The translation 'Definido como padrão' is a literal translation of 'Set to default' but might not be the most natural or idiomatic way to express this in Portuguese. Depending on the context, a more suitable translation might be 'Restaurar padrão' or 'Usar padrão'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider 'Restaurar padrão' or 'Usar padrão' depending on the context.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Romanian translation 'Setează valorile prestabilite' is a literal translation and doesn't fully capture the meaning of 'Set to default'. While technically correct, it sounds overly formal and technical for a common UI element.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a more natural Romanian phrase like 'Resetează la implicit' or 'Restabilește valorile implicite'. 'Resetează la implicit' is generally preferred for UI elements.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "පෙරනිමියට සකසන්න" is not the most natural or accurate translation of "Set to default". While technically correct, it sounds somewhat formal and clunky. A more common and natural phrasing would be something like "setDefault කරන්න" or "පහේමියට වෙනස් කරන්න".
While technically correct, "Nastaviť na predvolené nastavenia" is a bit verbose and formal for a simple "Set to default". A more natural and concise translation would be better.

The Serbian translation 'Постави на подразумевано' while technically conveying a similar meaning, isn't the most natural or common way to express 'Set to default'.  'Подеси на подразумеване' would be a more accurate and idiomatic translation.

While 'Postavi na podrazumevano' is understandable, a more natural and commonly used translation of 'Set to default' in Serbian (Latin) would be 'Podesi na podrazumevane vrednosti' or simply 'Postavi podrazumevano'. 'Postavi na podrazumevano' sounds a bit awkward.
